Take Home Ex3: VAST Challenge 2024 Mini-Challenge 3 [WIP]

Author

Kristine Joy Paas

Published

May 22, 2024

Modified

June 4, 2024

1 Overview

2 Setup

2.1 Loading Packages

pacman::p_load(
  jsonlite,
  tidyverse,
  ggraph,
  #tidygraph,
  visNetwork,
  patchwork,
  ggtext,
  knitr,
  igraph,
  ggiraph
)

We will also set some values to have consistency throughout all graphs. This is also so that we don’t have to search and replace all instances of these

FONT_FAMILY = "Roboto Condensed"

2.2 Loading Data

mc3_data <- fromJSON("data/mc3.json")
glimpse(mc3_data)

It contains graph data, where nodes can be accessed via nodes and edges via links. This dataset has a lot of columns but we will only filter the relevant data during wrangling..

3 Data Wrangling

3.1 Extracting Graph Elements

For simplicity, we will only extract the columns that are needed to do graph analysis. We will also ignore the time elements for now so we will not be including them in the analysis.

  • Nodes
  • Edges

The nodes represent the entities in the network. They can be people or companies.

mc3_nodes_raw <- as_tibble(mc3_data$nodes)
glimpse(mc3_nodes_raw)

We will only retain the following columns:

  • id - to serve as the identifier for the node

  • type - to differentiate people from companies in the graph.

mc3_nodes_lite <- mc3_nodes_raw %>% select(id, type)

The edges represent the relationship between different nodes.

mc3_edges_raw <- as_tibble(mc3_data$links)
glimpse(mc3_edges_raw)

We will only retain the following columns:

  • source - to identify the actor of the relationship, corresponds to id in nodes.

  • target - to identify the receiver of the relationship, corresponds to id in nodes.

  • type - to identify the type of the relationship

mc3_edges_lite <- mc3_edges_raw %>% select(source, target, type)

3.2 Closer look at type

Both the nodes and edges have type which contains the type of the nodes and edges. We will assign a supertype and a subtype from type.

  • Nodes
  • Edges
(mc3_nodes_lite$type) %>% unique()

supertype - type of entity, either Person or Organization

subtype - subcategory of supertype, e.g., Company, FishingCompany, CEO

(mc3_edges_lite$type) %>% unique()

supertype - type of relationship, either Ownership, Employment, Relationship.

subtype - subcategory of supertype, e.g., Shareholdership, BeneficialOwnership, FamilyRelationship

3.3 Preparing the data

With the considerations above, we will shape the data needed for our graph visualization.

  • Nodes
  • Edges

For nodes, we will also assign a shape for visualization depending on supertype. For people, we will use 📐, while we use 🔴 for organizations.

Lastly, we will assign numbers to each node as an alternative label to the ids (as they are long).

PERSON_SHAPE = "triangle"
ORGANIZATION_SHAPE = "circle"

mc3_nodes_clean <- mc3_nodes_lite %>%
  mutate(
    supertype = strsplit(type, ".", fixed=TRUE) %>% sapply('[', 2),
    # Get the last type as subtype. In the case of Entity.Person,
    # both supertype and subtype are "Person".
    subtype = strsplit(type, ".", fixed=TRUE) %>% sapply(tail, n=1),
    num = row_number(),
    shape = ifelse(supertype == "Person", PERSON_SHAPE, ORGANIZATION_SHAPE)
  ) %>%
  select(id, num, supertype, subtype, shape)

kable(head(mc3_nodes_clean))

Let’s also check if supertype, subtype, and shape have been mapped correctly.

mc3_nodes_clean %>%
  group_by(supertype, subtype, shape) %>%
  summarize(count = n()) %>%
  arrange(-count) %>%
  kable()

For ggraph to plot the edges correctly, we need to assigns weights to the edges. For simplicity, let us assign the number of edges with the same source, target and type.

Lastly, we will change source and target to from and to, respectively for compatibility with network functions we will use.

mc3_edges_clean <- mc3_edges_lite %>%
  rename(from = source, to = target, ) %>%
  mutate(
    supertype = ifelse(
      grepl("Event.Owns", type),
      "Ownership",
      ifelse(grepl("Relationship", type), "Relationship", "Employment")
    ),
    subtype = strsplit(type, ".", fixed = TRUE) %>% sapply(tail, n = 1)
  ) %>%
  filter(from != to) %>%
  group_by(from, to, supertype, subtype) %>%
  summarize(weight = n())

kable(head(mc3_edges_clean))

Lastly, let’s check if type has been mapped correctly to supertype and subtype.

mc3_edges_clean %>%
  group_by(supertype, subtype) %>%
  summarize(count = n()) %>%
  arrange(-count) %>%
  kable()

3.4 Preparing the supernetwork

We will prepare the supernetwork from the nodes and edges we prepared.

supernetwork = graph_from_data_frame(
  mc3_edges_clean, vertices = mc3_nodes_clean, directed = TRUE)

We call this a supernetwork as this is a collection of smaller, unconnected network

Why use `graph_from_data_frame` instead of `tbl_graph`?

tbl_graph requires the node and edge columns to be character. However, graph_from_data_frame does not require this and it can be used with both ggraph and igraph.

Hence, we will use this for convenience so we don’t need to convert to character everytime we add new columns to the node and edges.

4 Investigating SouthSeafood Express Corp

From VAST Challenge 2024 Mini-case 3:

Identify the network associated with SouthSeafood Express Corp and visualize how this network and competing businesses change as a result of their illegal fishing behavior. Which companies benefited from SouthSeafood Express Corp legal troubles? Are there other suspicious transactions that may be related to illegal fishing? Provide visual evidence for your conclusions.

Solving the smaller problem first

Although the question about SouthSeafood Express Corp is the last question, we will start with investigating its relationships so we can generalize to make inferences to the rest of the network, for Question 3.

To do the investigation, our strategy is to start with the smallest network first to the biggest. We will be looking at:

  1. Direct neighbors - They have the strongest influence on and can be influenced the most by SouthSeafood Express Corp.
  2. Sphere of influence - Based on Nicholas A. Christakis and James H. Fowler’s theory that influence gradually dissipates and eventually cease to be notable beyond the 3rd degree of separation.
  3. Full connected network - We will look at the entire network containing the nodes that have paths to SouthSeafood Express Corp.

In order to do this, we need to identify the SouthSeafood Express Corp node first.

ssfec_node <- which(V(supernetwork)$name == "SouthSeafood Express Corp")

We will use ego() and induced_graph() functions from igraph to generate the subnetworks related to this node.

We will use the function below to get the subgraphs:

extract_subgraph <- function(graph, nodes, distance, directed = TRUE) {
  vertices <- ego(graph, nodes = nodes, order = distance)[[1]]
  igraph_subgraph <- induced_subgraph(graph, vids = vertices)
  nodes_df <- as_data_frame(ssfec_direct_neighbors, what = "vertices") %>% rename(id = name)
  edges_sf <- as_data_frame(ssfec_direct_neighbors, what = "edges")
  graph_from_data_frame(edges_sf, vertices=nodes_df, directed=TRUE)
}

4.1 Direct Neighbors

We will first extract the direct neighbors for SouthSeafood Express Corp.

ssfec_direct_neighbors <- extract_subgraph(supernetwork, ssfec_node, 1, directed=TRUE)

ggraph(ssfec_direct_neighbors, layout = "nicely") +
  geom_node_point() +
  geom_edge_link()

We will first extract the direct neighbors for SouthSeafood Express Corp.

mc3_nodes <- as_tibble(mc3_data$nodes) %>%
  mutate(
    id = as.character(id),
    subtype = strsplit(type, ".", fixed=TRUE) %>% sapply(tail, n=1),
    type = strsplit(type, ".", fixed=TRUE) %>% sapply('[', 2),
    num = as.character(row_number())
  ) %>%
  select(id, num, type, subtype)

mc3_nodes %>% head(n = 10) %>% kable()

Extracting Edges

mc3_edges <- as_tibble(mc3_data$links) %>%
  mutate(
    from = as.character(source),
    to = as.character(target),
    subtype = strsplit(type, ".", fixed = TRUE) %>% sapply(tail, n = 1),
    type = ifelse(
      grepl("Event.Owns", type),
      "Ownership",
      ifelse(grepl("Relationship", type), "Relationship", "Employment")
    ),
    weight = 1
  ) %>%
  filter(from != to) %>%
  select(from, to, type, subtype, weight)#%>%
  #group_by(from, to, type) %>%
  #summarize(
  #  subtype = paste(subtype, collapse = " + "),
  #  weight = n()
  #)

mc3_edges %>% head(n = 10) %>% kable()
mc3_resource_flow <- mc3_edges %>% filter(subtype == "WorksFor") %>% mutate(weight = 1)
family <- mc3_edges %>% filter(subtype == "FamilyRelationship") %>% mutate(weight = 1)
family_reverse <- family %>% mutate(
  temp = to,
  to = from,
  from = temp
) %>% select(from, to, type, subtype, weight)
shareholdership <- mc3_edges %>% filter(subtype == "Shareholdership") %>% mutate(weight = 1) %>% mutate(
  temp = to,
  to = from,
  from = temp
) %>% select(from, to, type, subtype, weight)

ownership <- mc3_edges %>% filter(subtype == "BeneficialOwnership") %>% mutate(weight = 2) %>% mutate(
  temp = to,
  to = from,
  from = temp
) %>% select(from, to, type, subtype, weight)
mc3_resource_flow <- mc3_resource_flow %>%
  rbind(family, family_reverse, shareholdership, ownership)

Questions

Q4: Relations with SouthSeafood Express Corp

Direct Relations

Edges

ssfec_edges <- mc3_edges %>%
  filter(from == "SouthSeafood Express Corp" |
           to == "SouthSeafood Express Corp")
ssfec_edges %>% kable()

Nodes

ssfec_nodes <- mc3_nodes %>%
  filter(id %in% ssfec_edges$from |
           id %in% ssfec_edges$to) %>%
  mutate(
    focus = (id == "SouthSeafood Express Corp")
  )
ssfec_nodes %>% kable()

Graph

ssfec_graph <- tbl_graph(nodes = ssfec_nodes, edges = ssfec_edges, directed = TRUE)
#ssfec_graph <- graph_from_data_frame(ssfec_edges, vertices = ssfec_nodes, directed=TRUE)
ggraph(ssfec_graph, layout = "linear", circular = TRUE) +
  
  # Render nodes
  geom_node_point(aes(color = focus), show.legend = FALSE, size = 30) +
  geom_node_text(
    aes(label = str_wrap(id, width = -1)),
    family = font_family,
    size = 3,
    color = "white"
  ) +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("blue", "gold3")) +
  
  # Render edges
  geom_edge_link(
    aes(label = subtype),
    # Control arrow
    arrow = arrow(type = "closed", length = unit(0.025, "npc")),
    end_cap = circle(12, "mm"),
    start_cap = circle(12, "mm"),
    # Format labels
    angle_calc = "along",
    label_dodge = unit(0.04, "npc"),
    family = font_family,
    show.legend = FALSE
  ) +
  
  # Hack to reduce distance between nodes
  # This is to not clip the nodes in the edge of the plot
  # ref: https://stackoverflow.com/a/66991383
  ylim(-1.3, 0.8) +
  xlim(-1, 1) +
  
  # Style graph
  unset_graph_style() +
  theme_graph(base_family = font_family, plot_margin = margin(0)) +
  plot_annotation(
    title = "SouthSeafood Express Corp's Shareholders",
    subtitle = "Two other fishing companies, <span style='color:blue;'>**AguaLeska Transit N.V.**</span> and <span style='color:blue;'>**Tainamarine Fishing Co**</span> hold shares in<br />SouthSeafood Express Corp. They are posed to benefit the most from the company's illegal fishing activities") &
  theme(
    text = element_text(family = font_family),
    plot.title = element_text(face = "bold", size = rel(1.4)),
    plot.subtitle = element_markdown(color = "grey50")
  )

Sphere of Influence

graph <- graph_from_data_frame(mc3_edges, vertices = mc3_nodes, directed=FALSE)
ssfec_node = which(V(graph)$name == "SouthSeafood Express Corp")
dists <- distances(graph, v = ssfec_node) %>%
  as.data.frame() %>%
  pivot_longer(cols = mc3_nodes$id, names_to = "id", values_to = "distance") %>%
  filter(distance != Inf)

ssfec_nodes_full_network <- dists %>%
  left_join(mc3_nodes) %>%
  mutate(
    shape = ifelse(type == "Person", "triangle", "circle"),
    group = ceiling(distance/3) %>% as.factor()
  )

ssfec_edges_full_network <- mc3_edges %>%
  filter(from %in% ssfec_nodes_full_network$id,
           to %in% ssfec_nodes_full_network$id)
ssfec_nodes_influence <- ssfec_nodes_full_network %>%
  filter(group %in% c(0, 1))

ssfec_edges_influence <- ssfec_edges_full_network %>%
  filter(from %in% ssfec_nodes_influence$id,
           to %in% ssfec_nodes_influence$id)

ssfec_graph_influence <- tbl_graph(nodes = ssfec_nodes_influence, edges = ssfec_edges_influence, directed = TRUE)
#set.seed(608)
set.seed(911)
ggraph(ssfec_graph_influence, layout = "nicely") +
  geom_node_point(aes(
    color = group,
    size = distance,
    alpha = distance,
    shape = shape
    ),
  show.legend = FALSE) +
  geom_node_text(
    aes(label = str_wrap(id, width = -1)),
    family = font_family,
    size = 2.5,
    repel = TRUE
  ) +
  geom_edge_link(
    aes(label = subtype, edge_width = weight),
    arrow = arrow(type = "closed", length = unit(0.01, "npc")),
    end_cap = circle(4, "mm"),
    start_cap = circle(4, "mm"),
    angle_calc = "along",
    label_dodge = unit(0.02, "npc"),
    label_size = 2,
    family = font_family
  ) +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("gold3", "blue", "grey60", "grey80")) +
  #scale_size_manual(values = c(10, 5, 2, 1)) +
  scale_size_continuous(range = c(10, 6)) +
  scale_alpha_continuous(range = c(1, 0.7)) +
  scale_edge_width(range = c(0.5, 1))
kable(ssfec_nodes_influence %>% arrange(distance))
ggraph(ssfec_graph_influence, layout = "nicely") +
  geom_node_point(aes(
    color = group,
    size = centrality_eigen(),
    alpha = distance,
    shape = shape
    ),
  show.legend = FALSE) +
  geom_node_text(
    aes(label = str_wrap(id, width = -1)),
    family = font_family,
    size = 2.5,
    repel = TRUE
  ) +
  geom_edge_link(
    aes(label = subtype),
    arrow = arrow(type = "closed", length = unit(0.01, "npc")),
    end_cap = circle(4, "mm"),
    start_cap = circle(4, "mm"),
    angle_calc = "along",
    label_dodge = unit(0.02, "npc"),
    label_size = 2,
    family = font_family
  ) +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("gold3", "blue", "grey60", "grey80")) +
  #scale_size_manual(values = c(10, 5, 2, 1)) +
  scale_size_continuous(range = c(2, 15)) +
  scale_alpha_continuous(range=c(1, 0.7))
set.seed(888)
g <- ggraph(
  ssfec_graph_influence,
  layout = "nicely") +
  geom_point_interactive(
    aes(x = x, y = y, data_id = id, tooltip = id, color = group, shape = shape,
    size = distance, alpha = distance),
    show.legend = FALSE
    )+
  geom_node_label(
    aes(label = num),
    family = font_family,
    size = 2
  ) +
  geom_edge_link(
    aes(color = subtype, label = subtype,
      xend = jitter(xend, amount = 0.1), yend = jitter(yend, amount = 0.1)),
    arrow = arrow(type = "closed", length = unit(0.01, "npc")),
    end_cap = circle(4, "mm"),
    start_cap = circle(4, "mm"),
    check_overlap = TRUE,
    angle_calc = "along",
    label_dodge = unit(0.02, "npc"),
    label_size = 2
  ) +
  scale_size_continuous(range = c(20, 10)) +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("gold3", "blue", "grey60", "grey80")) +
  scale_alpha_continuous(range=c(1, 0.5))

girafe(                                  
  ggobj = g,                             
  width_svg = 6,                         
  height_svg = 6*0.618)

Full Network

ssfec_graph_full_network <- tbl_graph(nodes = ssfec_nodes_full_network, edges = ssfec_edges_full_network, directed = TRUE)
set.seed(888)
g <- ggraph(
  ssfec_graph_full_network,
  layout = "nicely") +
  geom_point_interactive(
    aes(x = x, y = y, data_id = id, tooltip = id, color = group, shape = shape,
    size = distance, alpha = distance),
    show.legend = FALSE
    )+
  geom_node_label(
    aes(label = num),
    family = font_family,
    size = 2
  ) +
  geom_edge_link(
    aes(color = subtype,
      xend = jitter(xend, amount = 0.1), yend = jitter(yend, amount = 0.1)),
    arrow = arrow(type = "closed", length = unit(0.01, "npc")),
    #end_cap = circle(4, "mm"),
    #start_cap = circle(4, "mm")
  ) +
  scale_size_continuous(range = c(15, 5)) +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("gold3", "blue", "grey60", "grey80")) +
  scale_alpha_continuous(range=c(1, 0.5))

girafe(                                  
  ggobj = g,                             
  width_svg = 6,                         
  height_svg = 6*0.618)
set.seed(888)
g <- ggraph(
  ssfec_graph_full_network,
  layout = "nicely") +
  geom_point_interactive(
    aes(x = x, y = y, data_id = id, tooltip = id, color = group, shape = shape,
    size = centrality_betweenness()),
    show.legend = FALSE
    )+
  geom_node_label(
    aes(label = num),
    family = font_family,
    size = 2
  ) +
  geom_edge_link(
    aes(color = subtype,
      #xend = jitter(xend, amount = 0.1), yend = jitter(yend, amount = 0.1)
      ),
    arrow = arrow(type = "closed", length = unit(0.01, "npc")),
    #end_cap = circle(4, "mm"),
    #start_cap = circle(4, "mm")
  ) +
  scale_size_continuous(range = c(10, 3)) +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("gold3", "blue", "grey60", "grey80")) +
  scale_alpha_continuous(range=c(1, 0.5))

girafe(                                  
  ggobj = g,                             
  width_svg = 6,                         
  height_svg = 6*0.618)
set.seed(888)
g <- ggraph(
  ssfec_graph_full_network,
  layout = "nicely") +
  geom_point_interactive(
    aes(x = x, y = y, data_id = id, tooltip = id, color = group, shape = shape,
    size = centrality_closeness()),
    show.legend = FALSE
    )+
  geom_node_label(
    aes(label = num),
    family = font_family,
    size = 2
  ) +
  geom_edge_link(
    aes(color = subtype,
      #xend = jitter(xend, amount = 0.1), yend = jitter(yend, amount = 0.1)
      ),
    arrow = arrow(type = "closed", length = unit(0.01, "npc")),
    #end_cap = circle(4, "mm"),
    #start_cap = circle(4, "mm")
  ) +
  scale_size_continuous(range = c(5, 10)) +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("gold3", "blue", "grey60", "grey80")) +
  scale_alpha_continuous(range=c(1, 0.5))

girafe(                                  
  ggobj = g,                             
  width_svg = 6,                         
  height_svg = 6*0.618)
set.seed(888)
g <- ggraph(
  ssfec_graph_full_network,
  layout = "nicely") +
  geom_point_interactive(
    aes(x = x, y = y, data_id = id, tooltip = id, color = group, shape = shape,
    size = centrality_eigen()),
    show.legend = FALSE
    )+
  geom_node_label(
    aes(label = num),
    family = font_family,
    size = 2
  ) +
  geom_edge_link(
    aes(color = subtype,
      #xend = jitter(xend, amount = 0.1), yend = jitter(yend, amount = 0.1)
      ),
    arrow = arrow(type = "closed", length = unit(0.01, "npc")),
    #end_cap = circle(4, "mm"),
    #start_cap = circle(4, "mm")
  ) +
  scale_size_continuous(range = c(5, 10)) +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("gold3", "blue", "grey60", "grey80")) +
  scale_alpha_continuous(range=c(1, 0.5))

girafe(                                  
  ggobj = g,                             
  width_svg = 6,                         
  height_svg = 6*0.618)
ssfec_edges_resource <- mc3_resource_flow %>%
  filter(from %in% ssfec_nodes_influence$id,
           to %in% ssfec_nodes_influence$id)

ssfec_graph_resources <- tbl_graph(nodes = ssfec_nodes_influence, edges = ssfec_edges_resource, directed = TRUE)

authority_scores <- authority_score(ssfec_graph_resources)
set.seed(888)
ssfec_graph_resources <- ssfec_graph_resources %>% mutate(authority_centrality = centrality_authority())

g <- ggraph(
  ssfec_graph_resources,
  layout = "nicely") +
  geom_point_interactive(
    aes(x = x, y = y, data_id = id, tooltip = id, color = group, shape = shape,
    size = authority_centrality),
    show.legend = FALSE
    )+
  geom_node_label(
    aes(label = num),
    family = font_family,
    size = 2
  ) +
  geom_edge_link(
    aes(color = subtype,
      #xend = jitter(xend, amount = 0.1), yend = jitter(yend, amount = 0.1)
      ),
    arrow = arrow(type = "closed", length = unit(0.01, "npc")),
    #end_cap = circle(4, "mm"),
    #start_cap = circle(4, "mm")
  ) +
  scale_size_continuous(range = c(5, 10)) +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("gold3", "blue", "grey60", "grey80")) +
  scale_alpha_continuous(range=c(1, 0.5))

girafe(                                  
  ggobj = g,                             
  width_svg = 6,                         
  height_svg = 6*0.618)

References

https://blogs.cornell.edu/info2040/2015/10/19/three-degrees-of-influence-how-far-can-you-reach-people/
